title: ROLL BACK THE NEW CLIENT TO ALPHA OR CONTINUE LOSING PLAYERS
body:
I apologize for the following post. It should serve as a warning to those posting when emotional.


ROLL BACK THE NEW CLIENT TO LEGACY*** OR CONTINUE LOSING PLAYERS

I am unable to even access the page to launch my legacy client anymore. The size for the initial splash screen is incorrect, and I'm only able to see the top left 60% of the splash screen. No launch button is visible. 

Like many others, I have had nothing but problems with your client changes. Roll back to legacy client as default or continue to lose players. That's not a threat as much as it is an accurate description of the situation. It strikes me as an obvious, simple and hard rule that one shouldn't release UNFINISHED UPDATES.

I feel strongarmed by Riot to use this new, pretty garbage. That's a terrible feeling to have as a paying customer.

replies.body: I apologize for the attitude I displayed in my above post. I really appreciate y'all at Riot and your attention to detail. Thank you for everything!
Yeah, I just had to fix my setting by going into the YAML file in preferences. Are you seriously rolling out garbage so broken a person has to manually edit client setttings?

I'm glad to hear you resolved your settings issue. The issue you experience with not being able to see the full client only happens on lower-resolution screens as far as I've seen. You can adjust the client's DPI scaling on the fly by hitting **CTRL** and **+** to increase size or **-** to decrease size. 

Additionally, since the new Client is [still in Beta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_release_life_cycle), we understand that there will be some bugs and performance issues along the way. This is why it's optional to upgrade to the Beta Client (you're given a prompt that lets you choose) and you can also launch directly into the Legacy Client at any time using the button at the login screen, as shown below:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/215576628/Launch-Legacy-Client.jpg

Let me know if you have any questions.

I apologize for the massive amount of tilt with which I originally posted. I am not using a lower end machine. 

1080GTX OC @ 1912MHz
Intel I7 6700K @ 4.4GHz
4k monitor

It happened because I had adjusted the resolution within the new client. Upon restarting the client, the launch window retained its original size, but kept the 1.5X zoom associated with the larger size I selected in the gameplay client. I appreciate your response and attention to this.

There's information about that too, but I haven't been able to get it to work. My user.config file didn't have anything in it when opened with Word, and I've tried launching NA and EUW. No joy.

Hey! I hope you see this, i'v been having trouble even running the alpha client, sometimes i can be a whole minute behind in champ select just because the animations are taking so long to load.

I think that you guys have too many animations running in the back ground of the client so people with non-gaming expensive computer's often have trouble running it.

And yes i do have animation turned off but it doesn't seem to do a thing.

Optimization is a huge priority for our New Client Team. Unfortunately, the Beta has had some issues running on lower-end hardware, as you mentioned. I'm confident that our team is aware of this and are working on resolving this in future Beta updates. For now, you may want to play League using the Legacy Client until the performance and resource management has been equalized a bit more.

I hope that clears up this issue for you.
